Method Detail

create

public static MessageFilter create()

setTimeoutRelativeToCreation

public MessageFilter setTimeoutRelativeToCreation(boolean b)
Set whether the timeout is relative to the creation of the filter, or the start of waitFor().

Parameters:
b - If true, the timeout is relative to the time at which setTimeout() was called, if false, it's relative to the start of waitFor().

setTimeout

public MessageFilter setTimeout(int timeout)
This filter will expire after the specificed amount of time. Note also that where two or more filters match the same message, the one with the nearer expiry time will get priority

Parameters:
timeout - The time before this filter expires in ms
Returns:
This message filter

onDroppedConnection

public void onDroppedConnection(PeerContext ctx)
Notify because of a dropped connection. Caller must verify _matchesDroppedConnection and _source.

Parameters:
ctx -

onRestartedConnection

public void onRestartedConnection(PeerContext ctx)
Notify because of a restarted connection. Caller must verify _matchesDroppedConnection and _source.

Parameters:
ctx -

onMatched

public void onMatched()
Notify waiters that we have been matched. Hopefully no locks will be held at this point by the caller.

onTimedOut

public void onTimedOut()
Notify waiters that we have timed out.

anyConnectionsDropped

public boolean anyConnectionsDropped()
Returns true if a connection related to this filter has been dropped or restarted.
